attributes.action: Keep ILR at 5 years and do not apply any retrospective immigration changes.
attributes.additional_details: Retrospective immigration changes would unfairly disrupt the lives of individuals who have planned their future around the existing 5-year ILR route. People already living, working and contributing to the UK should not have the terms of their settlement route changed suddenly. Stability and fairness require that new rules only affect future applicants.
attributes.background: The Government should keep the current 5-year qualifying period for Indefinite Leave to Remain and ensure that no new rules are applied retrospectively to people already on a valid route to settlement. Any changes should apply only to new applicants.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petitions:

Keep the 5-year pathway for all legal immigrants to apply for ILR

Make a law to protect ILR from abolition and retrospective changes
